Economic Boost: The erasure of world debt would lead to a significant increase in the global economy. With more money available to invest in businesses and infrastructure, countries would be able to grow their economies at a faster rate, leading to increased job opportunities and higher standards of living for people around the world.

Increased Consumer Spending: With no debt payments to make, people would have more disposable income to spend on goods and services. This would lead to an increase in consumer spending, which would in turn stimulate the economy and create more jobs.

Reduced Interest Rates: Without debt, central banks would not need to raise interest rates to control inflation. This would lead to lower interest rates, making it easier for people to borrow money to invest in businesses and real estate.

Increased Investment: With lower interest rates and more disposable income, people would be more likely to invest in stocks, bonds, and other financial instruments. This would lead to increased liquidity in the financial markets and higher stock prices.

Changes in Government Policy: The erasure of world debt would lead to a shift in government policy. Governments would be able to focus on other priorities, such as education, healthcare, and infrastructure, rather than debt repayment. This could lead to significant improvements in these areas and a better quality of life for people around the world.
